summary: This document contains FAA forms related to the airworthiness certification and maintenance of the aircraft registered as N405PJ, owned by Helibro LLC. It includes details about repairs, alterations, and compliance with aviation regulations, as well as the certification process for the aircraft's operational capabilities. This document appears to be a special airworthiness certificate for an experimental aircraft, detailing the operational limitations and requirements for its use. It outlines the conditions under which the aircraft can be operated, including restrictions on its use for military purposes and the necessity for compliance with FAA regulations. This document is a correspondence from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) regarding a request for a special airworthiness certificate for a Bell Helicopter Model 407 owned by Helibro, LLC. It outlines the requirements and conditions for the aircraft's operation, including limitations and necessary compliance with FAA regulations. This document is a request for a special airworthiness certificate for an experimental aircraft, specifically a Bell Model 407, to support flight testing for a dual cargo hook system. The request outlines compliance with FAA regulations and details about the aircraft's maintenance and operational parameters. This document contains multiple FAA Form 337 entries detailing major repairs and alterations made to the Bell Helicopter Model 407, registration N405PJ. The forms include descriptions of work accomplished, compliance with airworthiness requirements, and signatures of authorized individuals. The document is subject to a protective order. This document outlines the operating limitations and requirements for the Bell 407 helicopter with registration number N405PJ. It includes details on maintenance, inspection programs, and flight operations, emphasizing compliance with FAA regulations and safety protocols. The document is significant as it pertains to the airworthiness certification of the aircraft involved in the Epstein case. This document contains multiple FAA Form 337 entries detailing major repairs and alterations made to the aircraft with registration mark N405PJ and N491GM. The forms include information about the aircraft's maintenance, repairs, and compliance with federal aviation regulations, including the installation of various equipment and systems. This document details major repairs and alterations made to a Bell Helicopter Textron Model 407, including the installation of various systems and components. It includes information about the aircraft's owner, work accomplished, and compliance with FAA regulations. This document contains various FAA Form 337 entries related to the Bell 407 helicopter, including details about major repairs and alterations made to the aircraft. It includes information on installed avionics systems, compliance with airworthiness requirements, and certifications by authorized individuals. This document contains various FAA forms and correspondence related to the airworthiness certification of a Bell Helicopter Textron model 407, serial number 53375. It includes requests for certification, inspection reports, and compliance with FAA regulations, indicating the aircraft's readiness for operation and export.

events.title: Certification of Repairs and Alterations
events.description: Repairs and alterations to the aircraft N405PJ were certified by Dan McDevitt, ensuring compliance with FAA regulations.

events.title: Issuance of Special Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: A special airworthiness certificate was issued for the aircraft N405PJ, allowing it to operate under specific conditions.

events.title: Proposed Flight Testing
events.description: Flight testing for the helicopter is proposed to occur on or around November 7, 2019, as part of the request for the airworthiness certificate.

events.title: Flight Testing Request
events.description: A request for flight testing of the Bell Model 407 aircraft is made, scheduled for around November 7, 2019.

events.title: Application for Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: An application for a U.S. airworthiness certificate was submitted for the Bell Helicopter Model 407, registration N405PJ.

events.title: Installation of Radar Altimeter Antenna
events.description: Installed Helifab Inc. STC #SR02597LA Radar Altimeter Antenna in accordance with installation instructions.

events.title: Request for Special Airworthiness Certificate
events.description: A request was made for a special airworthiness certificate for the Bell 407 helicopter to support flight testing.

events.title: Installation of Secondary Belly Hard Point
events.description: Installation of a USFS required certified secondary belly hard point to provide the capability for installation of a government-provided secondary external load safety retainer.

events.title: Installation of Collective Safety Cover
events.description: Installation of Aeronautical Accessories, Inc. Collective Safety Cover referencing report number AA-96162 revision A.

events.title: Verification of Previously Installed Equipment
events.description: Verification of various equipment that was previously installed while the aircraft was outside the United States.

events.title: Airworthiness Certification
events.description: The Bell 407 helicopter was certified for airworthiness after various repairs and alterations were completed.

events.title: Installation of Avionics
events.description: Multiple avionics systems were installed on the Bell 407 helicopter, including communication and navigation systems.

events.title: Target Date for Certification
events.description: The target date for the certification of the Bell Helicopter Textron model 407 was set for May 28, 1999.

events.title: Submission of Airworthiness Documents
events.description: L. J. Theriault submitted various documents to the FAA for the airworthiness certification of the helicopter.
